subtasks: Observing seed potatoes for variations
Noting individual seed potato characteristics
Considering potato suitability for different uses (e.g., fish)
Identifying and setting aside specific varieties (e.g., blue, elephant garlic)
Checking for and removing damaged or unsuitable seed potatoes
Checking existing soil conditions (e.g., existing crops, previous garlic)
Preparing the ground for planting (e.g., tilling, loosening soil)
Incorporating additional crops (e.g., garlic) into the planting area
Ensuring the soil is suitable for the intended seed potatoes (e.g., proper nutrients, moisture)
Positioning seed potatoes in the prepared soil
Adjusting depth and spacing according to farming practices
Covering planted seed potatoes with soil
Watering the newly planted area

tasks.task: Observing and noting the potato selection process
subtasks: Recognizing different potato types (e.g., fingerlings, white, red)
Considering the impact of sun exposure on potato quality
Evaluating the potential harvest from the selected potatoes
